Book our Event Venue in Winter Park for your next Business Meeting or Social Event. Book Event Park Avenue Ballroom 5,000 square feet of flexible and hi-tech space makes it the perfect location for hosting a large meeting or corporate event. The Ballroom is divisible into five spaces and can accommodate a number of customized break-out and conference requirements. All spaces feature pull down screens and projectors. The Ballroom's elegant design and size is pristine for your Winter Park Wedding Venue choice. Inquire Today The Conservatory Considered the heart of The Alfond Inn, the Conservatory features a soaring glass domed ceiling, creating a light- filled space overlooking the Courtyard that is ideal for receptions and dinner. Beyond the Conservatory is 10,000 square feet of lushly landscaped green space in the garden Courtyard with built-in fire pits and an area designed for team building and al fresco events. Check Availability New England Room With just under 2,000 square feet, the New England Room is divisible by 2 for smaller break-out space and features state of the art audio visual equipment.  The New England Room has glass doors that open up to the New England Lawn, a beautiful space for meals and receptions . Book Meeting The Boardroom Florida sunshine pours into our new Boardroom, a 645 square foot meeting space with a traditional conference style table, comfortable leather chairs and is equipped with state of the art audio visual technology.  This stately boardroom can also serve as a private dining room space for small groups. Book Event Interlachen Room With just under 1,700 square feet, the Interlachen Room is divisible by 2 for smaller break-out space and features state of the art audio visual equipment. The Interlachen Room opens up to the Interlachen Lawn, a beautiful space for meals and receptions. Inquire Now Private Dining Room The Alfond Inn offers the ideal backdrop for a truly personal and intimate gathering. Our Private Dining Room, located in Hamilton's Kitchen accommodates up to 18 guests. From anniversary dinners to birthday brunches, your milestone event will be designed to your specific taste and preference. Reserve Now Event Deck Nestled on the second floor of The Alfond Inn, the Private Event Deck provides an ideal setting for a day of relaxation at The Spa. Additionally, it offers the perfect venue for evening receptions or special events that can accommodate up to 50 guests. Reserve Now The Courtyard Lawn Our 2,400 square foot Courtyard Lawn is surrounded by beautiful flowers with lush greenery and is the perfect backdrop for outdoor special events and team building activities. A work in progress, the collection is the brainchild of Barbara and Theodore Alfond (R'68), noted art collectors and several patrons of art institutions. Most of the Alfond Collection is installed at The Alfond Inn. The collection was conceived as a visual syllabus for the liberal arts values the Alfonds learned at Rollins and which shaped not only their student years but the rest of their lives. The curatorial narrative revolves around notions of critical thinking; literacy; enlarging one’s perspective; understanding other cultures and traditions; and language. Explore the Collection Our Boutique Hotel Winter Park, Florida Enjoy the boutique hotel Florida atmosphere with amenities to rival even the most luxurious hotels. With a stunning conservatory, lush courtyard, elevated pool & fitness center, The Alfond Inn one of the best hotels in Florida and poised to satisfy the casual traveler seeking quiet relaxation, and business clientele alike at our Winter Park FL Hotel. Explore the Hotel Our Packages If you prefer to call to reserve one of our Winter Park hotel packages, you may reach us at 407.998.8090 Romance in the Park One night stay in a classic room (Double Occupancy) One chilled bottle of prosecco in the room Dinner for two in Hamilton's Kitchen, tax and gratuity not included (Dinner valued at $80) Package price excludes gratuity and tax. Subject to availability. Adventures in the Park Two night stay in a classic room Two Winter Park boat tour Tickets Two tickets to the Charles Hosmer Morse Museum of American Art on Park Avenue Package price excludes gratuity and tax. Subject to availability. A Night at the Museum Two night stay in a classic room Two art-inspired cocktails in the Lounge Winter Park museum passes (entrance to the Rollins Museum of Art, the Charles Hosmer Morse Museum of American Art and Albin Polasek Museum & Sculpture Gardens) Enjoy The Alfond Collection of Contemporary Art throughout the hotel Package price excludes gratuity and tax. Subject to availability. All Packages Event Venues At our Hotel in Winter Park, Florida Overlooking the lush courtyard, the Conservatory at The Alfond Inn is the jewel center of our Winter Park Boutique Hotel and an ideal location for ceremonies or cocktails, with an available 5,000 sq. ft. ballroom and private dining areas. Adjacent to the library and reception space, the 1,026 sq. ft. Boardroom features the latest in A/V equipment and comfortable board-style seating. The Alfond Inn is one of the best hotels in Florida for you to host any event that you may have coming up! Book an Event Space The Spa The Spa at The Alfond Inn is the premier beauty and wellness destination for Winter Park locals and hotel guests looking to escape, indulge, and refresh. Offering an ambiance of stylish serenity, artfully curated wellness services, and bespoke body and skincare treatments, The Spa is where people come to seek peaceful and restorative time for themselves. About Our Spa Gallery Explore the Alfond Inn at Rollins College, a stylish boutique hotel in beautiful Winter Park, Florida that opened in 2013 and was recognized by Condé Nast Traveler - Readers' Choice Awards: Best hotel in Florida - 2014 - 2019. With our handy order tracking tool you can see: The date your order will be delivered The delivery carrier Where each part of your order will be delivered from When your Click & Collect order is ready to collect from your local store We're unable to offer live order tracking just yet, but we'll send you a text the day before your delivery with further details on when you can expect your order to arrive. Contact our customer service team When getting in touch with us, we need to confirm we’re talking to the right person. We’ll ask you a few questions to confirm you’re the person that paid for the order. If you’d like someone else to speak on your behalf, please ensure they’ve all the information necessary to pass our required Data Protection checks. Any conversation about order amendments, including refund requests, must be with the person that paid for the order. We are open: Monday - Saturday: 8am - 6pm Sunday: 10am - 5pm Here's some hints to help you choose the best way to contact us for your enquiry: Complete our Contact Form, scroll down, it's just below. We aim to respond to all enquiries within 48 hours. If you've received a damaged delivery or a faulty product, we'll ask you to email us some photos Use Live Chat - click ‘Chat’ on the bottom right of this page If you're unsure about what you've ordered If you've a question about our stock If you're asking about a delivery that's due today You can also call us on 0330 123 4123 If there's a queue you'll be given the option to ask for a call back. We’ll call you back when it's your turn. We’re open: Monday - Friday 8am - 6pm Saturday - 8am - 4pm To book a design appointment Whether you're looking for a new kitchen, bathroom or home office; our Design Consultants have the knowledge and expertise to help you plan your space perfectly. Complete our online form Call us on: 0800 011 3031 We’re open: Monday - Friday: 9am - 8pm Saturday & Sunday: 9am - 5:30pm Community programme and charity requests We support charities and local communities in two ways: Nationally, we’re proud to be supporting The Brain Tumour Charity as our corporate charity partner.  This means we’re unable to offer monetary support to other causes. Locally, we support  the community through our Wickes Community Programme by providing products to help local charities and not for profit community groups. To apply for a product donation just head in to your local store and speak to the manager. Terms and conditions Press and media Please contact the press office at Clarion Communications on (0)20 7479 0910 or email wickes@clarioncomms.co.uk . Please note, these contact details are for media enquiries only. Complaints Our Commitment We’re dedicated to providing a professional and valued service to our customers and partners. We strive to handle customer complaints promptly and fairly. Contacting Us If you're unhappy with something, the fastest way to reach us is through our online chat service. If you'd prefer to talk, call us at 0330 123 4123 : Choose option 1 for a Wickes kitchen, bathroom or home office complaint. Choose option 3 for all other complaints. To escalate your concern, use the contact form below. Select the relevant order type and choose "Something went wrong and I want to raise a complaint." We will acknowledge your complaint within 48 hours and forward it to the appropriate team. Further information might be needed to fully investigate your complaint. Alternatively, you can write to us at our registered address: Complaints Team Wickes Building Supplies Limited Vision House 19 Colonial Way Watford WD24 4JL To help us respond to you as quickly as possible, please include: Your name and address A contact phone number and email Your order number Details of your complaint with supporting photos Actions you’d like us to consider In the event that the customer services team is unable to resolve your complaint, or if you’re unhappy with the outcome, you can escalate your complaint by emailing customer.relations@wickes.co.uk , who will acknowledge your complaint within 48 hours and send it to the appropriate team. Resolution We aim to resolve your complaint at the first point of contact. Once the investigation is complete, you will be informed of the outcome. If you remain unhappy with the outcome, you can refer the decision to The Furniture and Home Improvement Ombudsman . They will review your case and may request further information from you or from us. Their decision will be binding upon us. For more information, visit fhio.org . Complaints relating to financial agreements If your complaint relates to the lender, it will be forwarded to them within five days of receipt. We will inform you once it has been sent. If the complaint is partially about the lender's actions, that part will be sent to the lender to investigate, while we will investigate the part related to the sale of the financial product and service. We will conduct a thorough and independent investigation and agree on a suitable outcome with you. Once our investigation is complete, we will inform you of the outcome. If you’re unhappy with the outcome, you can refer your complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service . A work in progress, the collection is the brainchild of Barbara and Theodore Alfond (R'68), noted art collectors and several patrons of art institutions. Most of the Alfond Collection is installed at The Alfond Inn. The collection was conceived as a visual syllabus for the liberal arts values the Alfonds learned at Rollins and which shaped not only their student years but the rest of their lives. The curatorial narrative revolves around notions of critical thinking; literacy; enlarging one’s perspective; understanding other cultures and traditions; and language. If your question is still unanswered after reading through our hotel policies, please feel free to contact us . Check-in Time: 4:00pm Check-out Time: 11:00am NON-SMOKING HOTEL The Alfond Inn is a smoke-free environment. There is no smoking allowed in guest rooms or inside the hotel. Designated outdoor smoking areas are available. REGISTRATION AGE Our minimum age to book reservations and check-in is 21 years old. CREDIT AND DEBIT CARD POLICY A credit or debit card is required to confirm your reservation. A credit or debit card must be presented along with a valid photo ID upon check-in. A pre-authorization amount will be placed on your card at check-in for the full length of the stay plus an additional $75 hold per day for incidentals. This is a temporary hold of a specific amount – it is not a charge to your account, but it can create a hold on those funds or against credit availability. We also may charge your card for any damage to the room or premises you or your guests cause. Once your actual incurred charges are posted at check-out, based on your bank, credit card company, or institution’s policy, it can take anywhere from 24 hours to 30 days for the original pre-authorization amount to be removed. It is your responsibility to be aware of how your bank, credit card company, or institution handles all of your transactions, including pre-authorizations. The hotel will not be responsible for any delay in releasing funds or returning availability or any fees or charges by your bank, credit card company, or institution as a result of your use of a credit or debit card. We are unable to remove pre-authorizations directly through our hotel. This policy applies to all reservations. CANCELLATION POLICY You may cancel your reservation for no charge before 11:59pm local hotel time up to 72-hours before arrival. Please note that we will assess a few 1 night rooms and tax if you must cancel after this deadline. The Cancellation Policy is subject to change based upon dates of stay, season, and method of reservation. Please contact the hotel for more information regarding your reservation. DAILY RESORT CHARGE A daily resort fee of $20 (plus tax) will be charged to your room rate per room, per night and includes: Complimentary Wi-Fi, two bottles of water daily replenished in your room, access to fitness center, access to our Pool Terrace and pool towels, access to popular news publications and 10% discount at The Spa and Hamilton’s Kitchen Restaurant. VALET PARKING We offer 24-hour valet parking. The valet parking fee is $30 per day plus applicable taxes. Overnight guests have in/out privileges. Day use parking is $17 plus applicable taxes. If you are visiting The Spa or Hamilton’s Kitchen, parking is complimentary. Self-parking is not available. DOG POLICY The Alfond Inn welcomes all well-managed dogs with no weight limit or breed restriction. Guests bringing dogs must have them leashed at all times when outside of the room. Guests will be charged a non-refundable fee of $50 per night, per dog; maximum of two dogs per room. Emotional support animals are not service animals under the ADA law. Service dogs will be exempt from this fee. Room type and location restrictions may apply, including our pools and restaurants. The dog-friendly rooms are restricted to our existing guest rooms and suites. Our new wing rooms and suites do not allow dogs. Guests will be responsible for any property damage inadvertently caused by their dogs or to any disruption of other hotel guests’ stay. Housekeeping service during your stay should be arranged either when you and your dog are not in the room, or if you are, the dog must be leashed or crated. Please read our Dog Policy for more information here . Our hotel is ADA compliant and service animals are welcome. WEAPONS POLICY Weapons are strictly prohibited on property. PHOTOGRAPHY AND VIDEO POLICY Our highest priority is the safety and privacy of our guests. Professional and/or commercial photography or videography is not permitted on the premises of The Alfond Inn without prior written authorization from the hotel management, including but not limited to filming, engagement photos, wedding photos, modeling shoots, etc. Drone photography/videography is strictly prohibited. Requests to use any area of the hotel as a location for photography or videography should be directed to the Marketing Team by calling us at 407-998-8090. If approved, shoots are subject to fees and schedule restrictions. ADDITIONAL POLICIES We reserve the right to cancel or modify reservations where it appears that a customer has engaged in fraudulent or inappropriate activity or under other circumstances where it appears that the reservations contain or resulted from a mistake or error. Rates quoted are based on check-in date and length of stay. Should you choose to depart early, the price is subject to change. Photos of guestrooms are representative of the general design and décor of the rooms. The exact layout and view in any of the guestroom photos are not guaranteed. Reagan brought years of hands-on construction experience as a foreman in the Waikato, while Toyah contributed her savvy business acumen. Together, they laid the foundation for what would become one of Hamilton’s most trusted kitchen renovation teams. The journey started with a single van, a leap of faith, and a passion for great design. Backed by the support of fellow tradesmen and a commitment to quality, Reagan left his 9-to-5 job, hired an apprentice, and focused on delivering bespoke kitchen makeovers that reflected both style and practicality. Word spread quickly, and soon kitchen renovation projects began to pour in—transforming the company’s focus and identity. As their reputation for craftsmanship grew, so did the team. Another apprentice joined, followed by a fully qualified carpenter, enabling Kitchen Renovations Hamilton to take on more complex and creative kitchen transformations across the region. Throughout it all, Reagan and Toyah balanced business growth with family life—raising three sons and welcoming a golden retriever into their busy household. In 2024, their hard work was formally recognized on a national scale. The company received multiple Master Builder Awards, including Gold, Top 100, and both regional and national honors, celebrating their dedication to quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction. Today, Kitchen Renovations Hamilton is proud to lead the way in custom kitchen design across the Waikato. With deep roots in craftsmanship and a passion for creating spaces that reflect the heart of the home, Reagan, Toyah, and their team continue to deliver kitchens that are built to last—and designed to inspire. Central Florida - Altamonte Springs Brevard County College Park DeSoto County Flagler County Horizon West Hardee County Hernando County Highlands County Hillsborough County Lake County Lake Nona Metro West Manatee County Osceola Oakland Park Pasco County Polk County Pinellas County Sarasota County Sumter County Seminole County Windermere Winter Garden Winter Park Menu Distro Locations Contribute Subscribe Follow us instagram facebook linkedin twitter youtube Search Search for: Search Latest stories Orlando Mom Collective to Host 4th Annual Women’s Wellness Event in Winter Park Central Florida Fall & Halloween Festivals 2025 Orlando to Celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month with Art Exhibit and Community Events Healthy Lunchbox Hacks from local doctors for Happier, More Focused Kids Orange County Medical Clinic to Offer Free Health Screenings During National Cholesterol Awareness Month Previous Next The Magic Behind Hamilton’s Kitchen: Deep Dive With the Chefs by Alexis George September 18, 2023, 2:55 pm Share Tweet Nestled inside the renowned Alfond Inn in Winter Park, Hamilton’s Kitchen is a haven where flavors, artistry, and passion align. At the restaurant, Executive Chef Stephen Doyle and twin Sous Chefs Neil and Matt Corbin craft meals into memorable experiences. Pulling back the curtain, we find that food is not just sustenance but a vibrant art form. Chef Stephen’s Unpredictable Journey: From Ireland’s green landscapes to mechanical engineering to Orlando’s bustling kitchens, Chef Stephen’s journey to Orlando was anything but predictable. “The funny story was when I came here, I ended up cutting my fingers, so I was like, ‘I’m never putting my fingers in the engine again,’ so I picked up a chef knife instead,” he laughed. Starting at Calico Jack’s Oyster Bar, his passion for delighting patrons propelled him up the culinary ranks. Today, as the Executive Chef of Hamilton’s Kitchen, he envisions a bustling space renowned for its five-star experiences. And what better way to reach the goal than by leading an extraordinary team that is just as passionate about food and results? The Corbin Twins: Culinary Synchrony Boston-born with Barbadian roots, Matt and Neil Corbin’s culinary love story began by watching their mother cook. While Neil’s culinary aspirations were clear early on, Matt’s shift from carpentry to cooking was a delightful twist. So, when their parents asked them to move to Orlando, they accepted the request. The rest is a match made in heaven. “Neil came to me first. If I forget something, he’s already done it, and to have somebody like that is amazing,” Chef Stephen said. “So, I said to him one day, ‘you don’t happen to have another one of you, and he goes, yeah, I do actually, my brother,’ so I got a two for one.” Matt and Neil have always shared similar interests. Sparked during the pandemic, their new love for gardening fuels their culinary creativity at home and work. “Growing our own food just makes us want to experiment with the fresh ingredients in our yard,” Neil shared, with Matt adding, “It’s best fresh. I love seeing everything grow from nothing to ready to pick and put on a plate.” Harmonizing at Hamilton’s Kitchen The twins constantly innovate, drawing inspiration from Disney Springs, cruises, YouTube and TikTok. They have different interests in food styles, but their synergy is undeniable. Matt and Neil even admit that they leave the kitchen the way the other likes. It makes for a seamless transition between the day and night shifts. “I don’t even hear them talk sometimes, but they can intertwine so well,” Chef Stephen comments. “There are never any complications, and they never have a bad word to say about each other; they’re just super cool.” Under Chef Stephen’s guidance, they’re now crafting their own menu items. The job may be challenging sometimes, but they enjoy the tough love. “[Chef Stephen] is awesome! He’s had my back since I started working here, so he always takes care of me,” Neil said. “He gave me a chance to be a sous chef,” Matt echoed. This trio’s collaboration is the cornerstone of Hamilton’s Kitchen’s success. Chef Stephen’s mentorship and the twins’ eagerness to learn and innovate create a nurturing and challenging dynamic. Together, they’re not just serving meals; they’re crafting experiences. Read Later Add to Collection Report Newsletter Want more stuff like this? Get the best local stories straight into your inbox! Join a diverse group of manufacturers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), innovators, suppliers, distributors, and educators as they present the latest advancements in composites manufacturing, product design, and materials engineering.
